channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Employers lobby to keep health care prices transparent in hopes of containing costs
item.description: Donald Trump's first administration advanced rules forcing hospitals and insurers to reveal prices for medical services. Employers don't want to risk ...

item.title: Here's what you need to know about the Pelicot trial
item.description: Judges have delivered verdicts on the defendants in a case that turned a 72-year-old woman into a feminist icon.

item.title: Macron lands in cyclone-hit Mayotte bringing food and health aid
item.description: Rescuers race to find missing people and survivors in the French territory devastated by Cyclone Chido.

item.title: Man accused in UnitedHealthcare CEO killing expected to appear at hearing on extradition to New York
Calling all students! NPR's Student Podcast Challenge returns for 2025
item.description: For it's seventh year, our national podcasting competition will invite students from around the country, in grades four through 12, to bring us their ...

item.title: Biden set an ambitious new climate goal. Will it still matter under Trump?
item.description: The Biden administration set a new climate goal for the U.S. The White House argues states, cities and corporations will continue the work, even as Tr...

item.title: Japanese city to name and shame people who break rubbish rules
item.description: Fukushima plans to go through trash that is not properly sorted, and publicly identify offenders.

item.title: At least 100 North Koreans dead in Ukraine war, says South
item.description: Some 1,000 have been injured and senior officers are among the casualties, an MP says, quoting officials.

item.title: Biden sets new climate goal for slashing U.S. greenhouse gas emissions
item.description: The new goal is part of the Paris Agreement​, under which member nations must update their emission cut targets every five years.

item.title: How the Assads used a civil war to turn Syria into a narco state
item.description: As Syria's economy collapsed during its civil war, the country became something of a narco state. The regime of ousted President Bashar al-Assad earne...

item.title: 'They don't live where we live': How communities hear each other in a divided country
item.description: NPR spoke with 30 small groups of people around the country about what they'd want other people to understand about their community — and what they wa...

item.title: 12/18: CBS Evening News
item.description: Last-minute government funding bill in limbo after opposition from Trump, others; Lawmakers target AI-generated “deepfake pornography”

item.title: 2 soldiers killed by landmine day after troops killed by booby trap
item.description: The incident happened one day after a blast caused by another improvised landmine killed two Mexican soldiers and wounded five others.

item.title: Biden pledges to cut US greenhouse gases by more than 60% as he exits world stage
Oklahoma set to execute man who killed girl, 10, during cannibalistic fantasy
item.description: Oklahoma is preparing to execute Kevin Underwood, who killed a 10-year-old girl ​during a cannibalistic fantasy. It would be the 25th and last schedul...

item.title: Wisconsin school shooter had 2 guns and got messages from man accused of plotting his own attack
item.description: Police say the shooter who killed a student and teacher at a religious school in Wisconsin this week brought two guns to the school.

item.title: Gisèle Pelicot's ex-husband found guilty in mass rape trial in France
item.description: A French judge has sentenced Gisèle Pelicot's ex-husband to 20 years in prison for drugging and raping her for years and inviting dozens of other men ...

item.title: Two missing and 13 dead after navy speedboat hits ferry off Mumbai
item.description: Three navy personnel are among the dead, while more than 100 people have been rescued, an official said.
